section.para:

TD Initiation

section.title: TD Initiation
section.para: This section describes the TD Initiation part of the menu and the forms it uses. Term deposits can be requested from the bank through a Term Deposit (TD) Initiation transaction. The Initiation request specifies the debit and Initiation account, but are not processed until confirmation (approval) is received from the bank.

section.para: This option allows a TD Initiation that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of TD Initiations that have been prepared and saved by users, but not yet submitted to the bank because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open the draft of the Term Deposit for further editing.

section.title: TD Initiation - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows the completion of a TD Initiation that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit.

When selected, this option will present a list of TD Initiations that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the Term Deposit in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Pending TDs
section.para: This function will display a list of all TD Initiation and Withdrawal records that have not been submitted to the bank. These can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity or CCY field.
There is also a Download File button where you can select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: CSV downloads the list to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the list to you machine as a spreadsheet.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools). When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingEL.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: TD Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Term Deposit records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: TD Maintenance - Unsigned TDs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) Term Deposit transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: TD Maintenance - Purged TDs
section.para: List and optionally delete Term Deposit transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: TD Maintenance - Rejected TDs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of Term Deposit records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
